Starting and Quitting DB Editor

Unlike Customize, you can use DB Editor while Anesthesia, PACU or Critical Care Manager is running; this allows you to see new content immediately.

You must have the system right DB Editor to work with this application. In addition, you need specific access rights to work with different types of database content:

Database content

System right needed to edit content

Clinical content

Orders Supervisor Options

Users, user groups,
prescription / validation rights

User Accounts Maintenance

Important: Only a database administrator with extensive knowledge of the Picis system should use DB Editor. Changes made using this tool affect the behavior of the entire Picis system immediately. Any unwanted changes must be reversed manually.

When working with DB Editor, you are advised to set the CacheRefreshProbability to 1 using CustomizeWorkstation User’s Guide. Restore the parameter to its normal setting when you are finished using DB Editor.
